Origins: On 8 April 2015, the web site The People's Cube published an article positing that a portrait of revered U.S. president Abraham Lincoln had been removed from display on a wall at the White House in order to make room for the hanging of a picture of the First Family's pet dogs:
Description: This article was widely circulated via social media, with many readers mistaking it for a genuine news report. However, the article was just a spoof from The People's Cube , a satirical conservative website that publishes (among other items) fictional news tidbits such as "Barack Obama finds out from CNN that Hillary Clinton spent four years being his Secretary of State" and "Obama vows ISIS will never raise their flag over the eighteenth hole."
Example: [Collected via e-mail, April 2015] Is this true? Lincoln's Portrait Removed for Picture of the First Dogs
Claim: A portrait of Abraham Lincoln was removed from the White House to make way for a picture of the Obamas' pet dogs.
